election_record.label: New York 1805 State Senate, Middle District

overview.note: Benjamin Herrick, Joseph C. Field, Veniah Woolley, Sheldon Munger and John van Benthuysen were candidates for Assembly in Dutchess County.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: Original election returns list 29 votes for Thomas Broadhead and 8 votes for Thomas Avery, though the official canvass of votes lists 23 votes for Broadhead and 7 for Avery.

sub_unit.name: Claverack
sub_unit.note: James G. Graham received 9 votes as John G. Graham.

sub_unit.name: Hudson
sub_unit.note: Robert L. R. Livingston received 1 vote as Robert T. Livingston.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: "At a meeting of the Republican Committees from the several towns in the County of Delaware, held at the Court-House in said County, on the 26th day of March, 1805. . . Resolved, that this committee will support the Republican nomination for Senators in the Middle District." Plebeian (Kingston, NY). April 8, 1805.

sub_unit.name: Carmel
sub_unit.note: James G. Graham received 18 votes as John G. Graham.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: Peter C. Adams received 1 vote as Peter D. Adams.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: Peter C. Adams received 1 vote as Peter G. Adams.

sub_unit.name: Phillips
sub_unit.note: James G. Graham received 5 votes as John G. Graham.

sub_unit.name: Poughkeepsie
sub_unit.note: Peter C. Adams received 1 vote as Peter G. Adams.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: Peter C. Adams received 1 vote as Peter G. Adams.
James G. Graham received 1 vote as James Graham.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: The Catskill Recorder (Catskill, NY), May 20, lists 536 votes for James G. Graham.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: Peter C. Adams received 8 votes as Peter C. Adam and 1 vote as Peter Adams.
James G. Graham received 1 vote as James Graham and 4 votes as John G. Graham.
The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 22, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21, list 1050 votes for Peter C. Adams.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The Plebeian, May 13, the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 16, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 15, list 906 votes for Peter C. Adams in Ulster county.
Peter C. Adams received 4 votes as Peter P. Adams and 85 votes as Peter C. Adam..
James G. Graham received 2 votes as James Graham.

sub_unit.name: Lumberland
sub_unit.note: "The nomination did not reach this town before the election closed." The Albany Register (Albany, NY). May 17, 1805.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Dutchess County Historian, Poughkeepsie.
Poughkeepsie Journal, and Constitutional Republican (Poughkeepsie, NY). May 21, 1805.
